Package br.com.ufs.orionframework.orion

Class Orion<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.ufs.orionframework.orion.Orion<T>
  • public class Orion<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Orion make all NGSIv2 operations by using objects java. Your objective is to let a little bit easier to developer do FIWARE applications using java.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Orion()
      Instantiate a Orion object running at localhost:1026 and listener running at 172.18.1.1:4041
      Orion​(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String listener)
      Instantiate a Orion object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.Object batchNotify​(java.lang.Object entities)
      This operation is intended to consume a notification payload so that all the entity data included by such notification is persisted, overwriting if necessary.
      java.lang.Object batchQuery​(java.lang.Object entities)
      The response is an Array containing one object per matching entity, or an empty array [] if no entities are found.
      void batchUpdate​(java.lang.Object batchEntities)
      This operation allows to create, update and/or delete several entities in a single batch operation.
      void createEntity​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Create a entity on Orion (require a IP + port from Orion Context Broker)
      void createRegistration​(java.lang.Object registration)
      this operation creates a new context provider registration.
      void createSimpleSubscription​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String type, int port, java.lang.String ip, java.lang.Boolean expires)
      this operation create a simple subscription on orion.
      void createSubscriptions​(Subscription subscription)
      this operation creates a new subscription on Orion.
      void deleteRegistration​(java.lang.String registrationId)
      this operation delete the Registration given your registrationId
      void deleteSubscription​(java.lang.String subscriptionId)
      this operation cancels subscription given a subscriptionId.
      java.lang.Object getAttributeData​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.String attrName, java.lang.Object obj)
      Return the object with the attribute data of the attribute.

      Returns the value property with the value of the attribute.

      this operation receive the Future which came from subscribeAndListen and turn on in a entity Object.

      Retrieves a list of entities that match different criteria

      this operation return the entity types from Orion.

      this operation lists all the context provider registrations present in the system.

      this operation returns a list of all the subscriptions present in the system.

      Delete the entity given id of the entity.
      void removeSingleAttribute​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.String attrName)
      Removes an entity attribute.
      void replaceAllEntitiesAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.Object obj)
      Replace attributes for the entity, given your id and object representing the new attributes.
      java.lang.Object retrieveEntity​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.Object obj)
      Given an Id and object that represents the entity required, returns an object updated from Orion.
      java.lang.Object retrieveEntityAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.Object obj)
      similar to retrieve the whole entity. this operation must return only one entity element.
      java.lang.Object retrieveEntityType​(java.lang.String entitytype, java.lang.Object obj)
      this operation return information about entity types from Orion.
      java.lang.Object retrieveRegistration​(java.lang.String registrationId)
      this operation return the Registration given your registrationId
      java.lang.Object retrieveSubscription​(java.lang.String subscriptionId)
      this operation returns a subscription given the subscriptionId

      this operation subscribe yourself on Orion to receive notifications about changed values
      void updateAttributeData​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.String attrName, java.lang.Object obj)
      Replace previous attribute data by the one in the object.

      given a object representing a new attribute, this operation turn it a new attribute value.
      void updateExistingEntityAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.Object obj)
      The entity attributes are updated with the ones in the object.
      void updateOrAppendEntityAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.Object obj)
      the entity attributes are updated (if they previously exist) or appended (if they don’t previously exist) with the ones in the payload.
      void updateRegistration​(java.lang.String registrationId, java.lang.Object registration)
      this operation delete the Registration given your registrationId
      void updateSubscription​(java.lang.String subscriptionId, java.lang.Object subscription)
      this operation update the subscription (Only the fields included in the request are updated in the subscription)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Orion

        public Orion​(java.lang.String url,
             java.lang.String listener)
        Instantiate a Orion object.
        Parameters:
        url - An IP address + Port String from where the Orion is running.
        listener - An IP address + Port from where the server is listening the changes that was subscribed.

      • Orion

        public Orion()
        Instantiate a Orion object running at localhost:1026 and listener running at 172.18.1.1:4041

    • Method Detail

      • createEntity

        public void createEntity​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Create a entity on Orion (require a IP + port from Orion Context Broker)
        Parameters:
        obj - An given object representing the entity. The object follows the JSON entity representation format (described in a “JSON Entity Representation” section) on NGSIv2 docs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • listEntities

        public Entity[] listEntities​(java.lang.String criteria)
        Retrieves a list of entities that match different criteria
        Parameters:
        criteria - can be defined by id, entitytype, pattern matching (either id or entitytype).
        Returns:
        An Array with all objects (EntityId and entitytype) registered on orion. the JSON entity representation format (described in a “JSON Entity Representation” section) on NGSIv2 docs.

      • retrieveEntity

        public java.lang.Object retrieveEntity​(java.lang.String entityId,
                                       java.lang.Object obj)
        Given an Id and object that represents the entity required, returns an object updated from Orion.
        Parameters:
        entityId - an identifier from entity
        obj - the object that represents the entity
        Returns:
        a object updated from entity
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity​(java.lang.String entityId)
        Delete the entity given id of the entity.
        Parameters:
        entityId - Id of the entity to be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • retrieveEntityAttributes

        public java.lang.Object retrieveEntityAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId,
                                                 java.lang.Object obj)
        similar to retrieve the whole entity. this operation must return only one entity element. This operation retrieve only attribute fields from entity, so, id and type not come from the request.
        Parameters:
        entityId - Id of the entity to be retrieved
        obj - the object that represents the entity
        Returns:
        a object representing the entity
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        retrieveEntity(String, Object)

      • replaceAllEntitiesAttributes

        public void replaceAllEntitiesAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId,
                                         java.lang.Object obj)
        Replace attributes for the entity, given your id and object representing the new attributes. Change id and entitytype for entity is not allowed.
        Parameters:
        entityId - Id of the entity to be retrieved
        obj - object representing the new attributes for the entity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • updateOrAppendEntityAttributes

        public void updateOrAppendEntityAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId,
                                           java.lang.Object obj)
        the entity attributes are updated (if they previously exist) or appended (if they don’t previously exist) with the ones in the payload.
        Parameters:
        entityId - Id of the entity to be retrieved
        obj - object representing the attributes to append or update
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • updateExistingEntityAttributes

        public void updateExistingEntityAttributes​(java.lang.String entityId,
                                           java.lang.Object obj)
        The entity attributes are updated with the ones in the object. The attributes must already exists before send this update.
        Parameters:
        entityId - Id of the entity to be retrieved
        obj - an object representing the attributes to update.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

                                 java.lang.String attrName,
                                 java.lang.Object obj)

        attrName - Name of the attribute to be retrieved.
        obj - object that represents the attribute to update.

        Returns:
        a list of all the subscriptions present in the system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests.

      • createSubscriptions

        public void createSubscriptions​(Subscription subscription)
        this operation creates a new subscription on Orion.
        Parameters:
        subscription - an given subscription object which represents a subscription on JSON format from Orion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • retrieveSubscription

        public java.lang.Object retrieveSubscription​(java.lang.String subscriptionId)
        this operation returns a subscription given the subscriptionId
        Parameters:
        subscriptionId - an given id from subscription.
        Returns:
        a subscription that has the subscriptionId given.

      • deleteSubscription

        public void deleteSubscription​(java.lang.String subscriptionId)
        this operation cancels subscription given a subscriptionId.
        Parameters:
        subscriptionId - When a subscription is created, a message is received on url defined on subscription This url contains a Location header which holds the subscription ID: a 24 digit hexadecimal number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • updateSubscription

        public void updateSubscription​(java.lang.String subscriptionId,
                               java.lang.Object subscription)
        this operation update the subscription (Only the fields included in the request are updated in the subscription)
        Parameters:
        subscriptionId -
        subscription -

      • createSimpleSubscription

        public void createSimpleSubscription​(java.lang.String id,
                                     java.lang.String type,
                                     int port,
                                     java.lang.String ip,
                                     java.lang.Boolean expires)
        this operation create a simple subscription on orion. this subscription reacts (trigger notifications) to any changes on attributes. this subscription expires at 2040-04-05T14:00:00Z.
        Parameters:
        id - an given id from entity. (can be a regex)
        type - an given type from entity.
        port - an given port from where the server is listening the notifications.
        ip - an given ip from where the server is running.
        expires - an given boolean, if false, the subscription has not expires time, if true, has expire time defined at 2040-04-05T14:00:00Z.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)

      • subscribeAndListen

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.String> subscribeAndListen​(java.lang.String id,
                                                                        java.lang.String type,
                                                                        int port,
                                                                        java.lang.String ip)
        this operation subscribe yourself on Orion to receive notifications about changed values
        Parameters:
        port - an given port from where the server is listening.
        ip - an given IP address from where the server is running.
        Returns:
        a Future value, to retrieve the entity value, you must use this method and call getSubscriptionUpdate method after.
        See Also:
        getSubscriptionUpdate(java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.String>, java.lang.Object)

      • getSubscriptionUpdate

        public java.lang.Object getSubscriptionUpdate​(java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.String> f,
                                              java.lang.Object obj)
                                       throws java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                              java.lang.InterruptedException
        this operation receive the Future which came from subscribeAndListen and turn on in a entity Object.
        Parameters:
        f - a future object holding the notification payload which came from subscribeAndListen.
        obj - a entity object.
        Returns:
        a entity Object filled with informations from notification.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        subscribeAndListen(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String)

      • listRegistrations

        public void listRegistrations()
        this operation lists all the context provider registrations present in the system.

      • createRegistration

        public void createRegistration​(java.lang.Object registration)
        this operation creates a new context provider registration. Typically used for binding context sources as providers of certain data.
        Parameters:
        registration -

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        registrationId -

      • updateRegistration

        public void updateRegistration​(java.lang.String registrationId,
                               java.lang.Object registration)
        this operation delete the Registration given your registrationId
        Parameters:
        registrationId -
        registration -

      • batchUpdate

        public void batchUpdate​(java.lang.Object batchEntities)
        This operation allows to create, update and/or delete several entities in a single batch operation. Given the entities object that represents the entities
        Parameters:
        batchEntities - a batch object containing all entities to be updated on orion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to http requests.

        public java.lang.Object batchQuery​(java.lang.Object entities)
        The response is an Array containing one object per matching entity, or an empty array [] if no entities are found.
        Parameters:
        entities -

        entities -
